intro: Erysimum capitatum f. pallidum, commonly known as the pale flowering wallflower, is a compact, herbaceous perennial native to southern Europe. It features dense clusters of small, pale yellow or white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has hairy, linear leaves that are typically bluish-green in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in rocky or gravelly habitats. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation in gardens.
